Description: Minimum 4.5:1 for normal text and 3:1 for large text (18px+ bold or 24px+)
Do: Test all text colors against backgrounds using contrast checker tools
Don't: Rely on visual judgment alone ‚Äî always measure
Screen_Reader_Note: Low contrast text is invisible to low-vision users

Description: Minimum 3:1 for UI components and graphical objects against adjacent colors
Do: Ensure borders and icons meet 3:1 against background
Don't: Use thin light-gray borders on white backgrounds
Screen_Reader_Note: Icons and borders must be perceivable

Description: Never use color alone to convey information ‚Äî add text/icon/pattern
Do: Combine color with icons and text labels
Don't: Use red/green only for error/success states
Code_Bad: Error: field border turns red with no text
Screen_Reader_Note: Color-blind users (8% of males) cannot distinguish red/green

Description: Ensure contrast ratios are maintained in dark mode ‚Äî avoid pure white on black
Do: Use off-white (#e2e8f0) on dark gray (#1e293b) for comfortable reading
Don't: Use #ffffff on #000000 ‚Äî causes halation for astigmatic users
Screen_Reader_Note: Pure white text on black causes eye strain

Description: Logical tab order following visual flow ‚Äî left to right and top to bottom
Do: Use semantic HTML elements in DOM order matching visual layout
Don't: Use tabindex > 0 ‚Äî creates unpredictable tab order
Code_Good: Natural DOM order: nav ‚Üí main ‚Üí sidebar
Screen_Reader_Note: Tab order must be predictable for keyboard-only users

Description: All interactive elements must show visible focus indicator
Do: Use :focus-visible with 2px+ outline and offset
Don't: Remove outline with outline:none without replacement
Screen_Reader_Note: Invisible focus = invisible cursor for keyboard users

Description: Provide skip link to bypass repeated navigation
Do: First focusable element: skip to main content link
Don't: Force users to tab through entire nav on every page
Code_Bad: No skip link ‚Äî 50+ tab stops before content
Screen_Reader_Note: Essential for screen reader and keyboard users

Description: Contain focus within modals and dialogs ‚Äî prevent tabbing behind overlay
Do: Trap focus inside modal; return focus to trigger on close
Don't: Allow focus to escape behind modal overlay
Code_Good: focusTrap.activate() on modal open; deactivate() on close
Code_Bad: Tab goes behind modal to invisible elements
Screen_Reader_Note: Users get lost behind modal without focus trap

Description: Provide keyboard shortcuts for common actions
Do: Use standard shortcuts (Ctrl+S Ctrl+Z) and document custom ones
Don't: Create conflicting shortcuts with browser/OS defaults
Code_Bad: Alt+S conflicts with browser menu access key
Screen_Reader_Note: Power users rely on keyboard shortcuts

Description: Descriptive alt text for meaningful images ‚Äî empty alt for decorative
Do: Write descriptive alt text: 'Chart showing 40% increase in Q3 revenue'
Don't: Use filename as alt: 'IMG_2847.jpg' or 'image'
Screen_Reader_Note: Screen readers read alt text ‚Äî poor alt = poor experience

Description: Use semantic HTML5 landmarks for page structure
Do: Use <header> <nav> <main> <aside> <footer>
Don't: Use <div> for everything with no semantic meaning
Screen_Reader_Note: Landmarks let screen reader users jump between sections

Description: Announce dynamic content changes to screen readers
Do: Use aria-live='polite' for updates and 'assertive' for errors
Don't: Update DOM silently ‚Äî screen readers miss changes
Code_Bad: Silent DOM update after search ‚Äî user unaware
Screen_Reader_Note: Dynamic updates invisible without aria-live

Description: Single h1 per page with sequential heading levels
Do: Use h1 ‚Üí h2 ‚Üí h3 in order ‚Äî no skipping levels
Don't: Skip from h1 to h4 or use headings for styling only
Screen_Reader_Note: Headings are primary navigation mechanism for screen readers

Description: Every form input must have an associated label
Do: Use <label for='id'> or aria-label/aria-labelledby
Don't: Use placeholder as sole label ‚Äî disappears on input
Screen_Reader_Note: Screen readers skip inputs without labels

Description: Use ARIA roles only when no native HTML element exists
Do: Use <button> not <div role='button'>
Don't: Add ARIA roles to elements that already have semantic meaning
Screen_Reader_Note: Native HTML elements have built-in a11y ‚Äî ARIA is a patch

Description: Use aria-expanded/aria-selected/aria-checked for interactive state
Do: Toggle aria-expanded on accordion/dropdown triggers
Don't: Change visual state only without updating ARIA
Screen_Reader_Note: Screen readers rely on ARIA states to understand UI state

Description: Use aria-describedby for supplementary instructions
Do: Link error messages and hints to inputs with aria-describedby
Don't: Put instructions in tooltip only ‚Äî inaccessible
Screen_Reader_Note: Provides additional context without cluttering labels

Description: Use aria-hidden to hide decorative or redundant content
Do: Use aria-hidden='true' on decorative icons next to text labels
Don't: Apply aria-hidden to content that should be accessible
Screen_Reader_Note: Hides irrelevant content from screen reader clutter

Description: Minimum 44x44px tap targets on touch devices
Do: Use min-height: 44px; min-width: 44px for all interactive elements
Don't: Use 24px or smaller touch targets on mobile
Screen_Reader_Note: Small targets cause mis-taps especially for motor-impaired users

Description: Minimum 8px gap between adjacent touch targets
Do: Add gap or margin between close interactive elements
Don't: Stack 44px buttons edge-to-edge with no gap
Code_Bad: Adjacent links with no spacing ‚Äî wrong target hit
Screen_Reader_Note: Prevents accidental activation of wrong control

Description: Respect prefers-reduced-motion for all animations
Do: Provide @media query to disable/reduce all animations
Don't: Ignore motion preference ‚Äî causes vestibular issues
Code_Bad: No reduced-motion query ‚Äî animations always play
Screen_Reader_Note: 1 in 3 people experience motion sensitivity

Description: Provide pause/stop for auto-playing content
Do: Add visible pause button for carousels and video
Don't: Auto-play video/carousel with no stop mechanism
Screen_Reader_Note: Auto-play is distracting and blocks comprehension

Description: No content flashes more than 3 times per second
Do: Limit animation frequency ‚Äî no strobing effects
Don't: Use rapid blinking or flashing text/backgrounds
Code_Good: Subtle fade transitions at max 2 flashes/sec
Screen_Reader_Note: Flashing can cause seizures in photosensitive epilepsy

Description: Clearly identify and describe form errors in text
Do: Show error message near field with icon + red text + description
Don't: Show red border only with no text explanation
Code_Bad: Red border only ‚Äî user guesses the problem
Screen_Reader_Note: Screen readers need text descriptions of errors

Description: Suggest corrections for detected input errors
Do: Provide specific fix: 'Did you mean user@gmail.com?'
Don't: Show generic 'Invalid input' for all errors
Screen_Reader_Note: Specific suggestions reduce user frustration and errors

Description: Allow review and correction before irreversible actions
Do: Add confirmation dialog for delete/submit actions
Don't: Immediate irreversible action on single click
Code_Good: Confirm dialog: 'Delete account? This cannot be undone.'
Screen_Reader_Note: Prevents catastrophic errors especially for cognitively impaired

Description: Declare page language and lang changes within content
Do: Set <html lang='en'> and mark foreign text with lang attr
Don't: Omit lang attribute ‚Äî screen readers use wrong pronunciation
Screen_Reader_Note: Screen readers use lang to select correct speech synthesizer

Description: Unique descriptive title for every page
Do: Format: 'Page Name ‚Äî Site Name' or 'Page Name | Site Name'
Don't: Use same title on all pages or generic 'Home'
Screen_Reader_Note: First thing screen readers announce ‚Äî must be descriptive

Description: Link text makes sense out of context
Do: Use descriptive link text: 'View Q3 revenue report'
Don't: Use 'click here' or 'read more' as link text
Screen_Reader_Note: Screen readers list all links ‚Äî 'click here' x20 is useless

Description: Use proper table markup with headers for data tables
Do: Use <th scope='col/row'> and <caption> for data tables
Don't: Use divs/spans styled as tables ‚Äî no semantic meaning
Screen_Reader_Note: Screen readers navigate tables by row/column headers

Description: Provide captions for all prerecorded video/audio
Do: Use synchronized captions (SRT/VTT) for all video content
Don't: Rely on auto-generated captions without review
Code_Bad: No captions ‚Äî deaf users miss all audio content
Screen_Reader_Note: Captions essential for deaf/hard-of-hearing users

Description: Describe visual-only content in video for blind users
Do: Add audio description track for visual-only information
Don't: Assume all content is conveyed through audio
Code_Bad: Video tutorial with 'click the blue button' (which one?)
Screen_Reader_Note: Blind users miss visual-only content in video

Description: Provide text transcript for all audio/video content
Do: Full text transcript with speaker labels and timestamps
Don't: Provide only auto-generated summary
Code_Good: Full transcript with [Speaker Name]: dialogue format
Code_Bad: No transcript ‚Äî content locked in media format
Screen_Reader_Note: Transcripts benefit deaf and deafblind users plus searchability

Description: Content usable at 200% zoom without horizontal scroll
Do: Ensure layout reflows at 200% zoom ‚Äî no horizontal scrollbar
Don't: Use fixed pixel widths that break at zoom
Code_Good: Use rem/em units and responsive layout
Screen_Reader_Note: Low-vision users zoom to 200-400% regularly

Description: Content readable with increased text spacing
Do: Allow custom line-height word-spacing letter-spacing without breaking
Don't: Use fixed height containers that clip text on spacing change
Code_Good: Flexible containers with min-height not height
Code_Bad: Fixed height div overflow:hidden clips spaced text
Screen_Reader_Note: Users with dyslexia need increased spacing

Description: Use plain language and short sentences
Do: Write at 8th-grade reading level with short paragraphs
Don't: Use jargon and complex sentences
Code_Bad: Actuate the persistence mechanism via the CTA affordance
Screen_Reader_Note: Cognitive disabilities affect 1 in 4 adults

Description: Same navigation pattern on every page
Do: Keep nav position and order identical across all pages
Don't: Move navigation to different positions on different pages
Code_Good: Consistent top nav on all pages
Code_Bad: Nav on top for home ‚Äî side nav for dashboard
Screen_Reader_Note: Consistency reduces cognitive load especially for impaired users

Description: Warn users before session timeout with option to extend
Do: Show warning 2 minutes before timeout with extend button
Don't: Silently log out and lose user's work
Screen_Reader_Note: Users with disabilities need more time to complete tasks

Description: Use axe-core or Lighthouse for automated a11y checks
Do: Run axe-core in CI/CD pipeline to catch regression
Don't: Rely on manual testing only ‚Äî too error-prone
Code_Bad: No automated checks ‚Äî a11y bugs slip through
Screen_Reader_Note: Automated tools catch 30-40% of a11y issues

Description: Keyboard + screen reader testing for all interactive flows
Do: Test with NVDA/VoiceOver + keyboard-only navigation monthly
Don't: Never test with actual assistive technology
Code_Good: Tab through entire flow with screen reader on
Screen_Reader_Note: Manual testing catches 60-70% of issues automated tools miss
